Service class used by (future) highlighting controls and display forms.

Field Detail

GLOBAL_CONTROL_ID

public static final String GLOBAL_CONTROL_ID
This is the html ID that the client-side javascript uses to update page-wide controls. Set your markup ID to this value if you hlde page-wide highlight controls.

See Also:

Method Detail

get

public static HighlightService get()

addHighlighter

public void addHighlighter(Character c,
                           String label,
                           boolean editable)
Register a highlighter for this application. The character key will determine how the CSS styles and javascript function. This method does not check to see if an appropriate style exists.

Parameters:
c - the style character, e.g. 'Y' tends to be for the color yellow
label - the name of this highlighter

getHighlighter

public HighlightService.HighlightType getHighlighter(Character c)
Get a higlighter associated with this character

Parameters:
c -
Returns:
the highlighter, or null if not found

getHighlighters

public List<HighlightService.HighlightType> getHighlighters()

encodeHighlights

public String encodeHighlights(List<Character> colors,
                               List<String> highlights)
Converts a list of color characters (R = Red, B = Blue, etc) and their corresponding highlighted words into a single, encoded string to be stored in the database.

Parameters:
colors - a list of color characters
highlights - a list of highlighted words (default: CSV of word indexes)
Returns:
the encoded string.
See Also:
decodeHighlights(String)

decodeHighlights

public Map<Character,String> decodeHighlights(String s)
Converts an encoded highlighting string into a map of Color to CSV of words. By default, the string is in the format:

R:1,2,3#B:12,13,14,15#Y:22,23,24

In the above example, the first three words are highlighted with Red and the twelfth through fifteenth words are highlighted with Blue, etc.

Parameters:
s - the encoded string
Returns:
the map of color letters to CSV defined highlighting.
See Also:
encodeHighlights(List, List)
